segment.source: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive

segment.source: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive

segment.source: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive
segment.target: How to Recover a Corrupted Drive

segment.source: You can use this procedure with the Administration and Monitoring Website (also referred to as the Help Desk) Website to recover a corrupted drive that is protected by BitLocker.
segment.target: You can use this procedure with the Administration and Monitoring Website (also referred to as the Help Desk) Website to recover a corrupted drive that is protected by BitLocker.

segment.source: To do this, you will complete the tasks outlined in the following table.
segment.target: To do this, you will complete the tasks outlined in the following table.

segment.source: Task
segment.target: Task

segment.source: Details and more information
segment.target: Details and more information

segment.source: Create a recovery key package file by accessing the Drive Recovery area of the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Create a recovery key package file by accessing the Drive Recovery area of the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: To access the Drive Recovery area, you must be assigned the MBAM Helpdesk Users role or the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users role.
segment.target: To access the Drive Recovery area, you must be assigned the MBAM Helpdesk Users role or the MBAM Advanced Helpdesk Users role.

segment.source: You may have given these roles different names when you created them.
segment.target: You may have given these roles different names when you created them.

segment.source: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts.
segment.target: For more information, see Planning for MBAM 2.5 Groups and Accounts.

segment.source: Copy the package file to the computer that contains the corrupted drive.
segment.target: Copy the package file to the computer that contains the corrupted drive.

segment.source: Use the command to complete the recovery process.
segment.target: Use the command to complete the recovery process.

segment.source: To avoid a potential loss of data, it is strongly recommended that you review the Manage-bde command before using it.
segment.target: To avoid a potential loss of data, it is strongly recommended that you review the Manage-bde command before using it.

segment.source: To recover a corrupted drive
segment.target: To recover a corrupted drive

segment.source: Open a web browser and navigate to the Administration and Monitoring Website.
segment.target: Open a web browser and navigate to the Administration and Monitoring Website.

segment.source: In the left pane, select Drive Recovery to open the Recover access to an encrypted drive page.
segment.target: In the left pane, select Drive Recovery to open the Recover access to an encrypted drive page.

segment.source: Enter the end user’s Windows log-on domain and user name, the reason for unlocking the drive, and the end user’s recovery password ID.
segment.target: Enter the end user’s Windows log-on domain and user name, the reason for unlocking the drive, and the end user’s recovery password ID.

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: If you are a member of the Advanced Helpdesk Users access group, you do not have to enter the user’s domain name or user name.
segment.target: If you are a member of the Advanced Helpdesk Users access group, you do not have to enter the user’s domain name or user name.

segment.source: Click Submit.
segment.target: Click Submit.

segment.source: The recovery key will be displayed.
segment.target: The recovery key will be displayed.

segment.source: Click Save, and then select Recovery Key Package.
segment.target: Click Save, and then select Recovery Key Package.

segment.source: The recovery key package will be created on your computer.
segment.target: The recovery key package will be created on your computer.

segment.source: Copy the recovery key package to the computer that has the corrupted drive.
segment.target: Copy the recovery key package to the computer that has the corrupted drive.

segment.source: Open an elevated command prompt.
segment.target: Open an elevated command prompt.

segment.source: To do this, click Start and type in the Search programs and files text box.
segment.target: To do this, click Start and type in the Search programs and files text box.

segment.source: Right-click cmd.exe, and select Run as Administrator.
segment.target: Right-click cmd.exe, and select Run as Administrator.

segment.source: At the command prompt, type the following:
segment.target: At the command prompt, type the following:

segment.source: Note
segment.target: Note

segment.source: Replace fixed drive with an available hard disk drive that has free space equal to or larger than the data on the corrupted drive.
segment.target: Replace fixed drive with an available hard disk drive that has free space equal to or larger than the data on the corrupted drive.

segment.source: Data on the corrupted drive is recovered and moved to the specified hard disk drive.
segment.target: Data on the corrupted drive is recovered and moved to the specified hard disk drive.

segment.target: Got a suggestion for MBAM?

segment.target: Add or vote on suggestions here.

segment.target: Got a MBAM issue?

segment.target: Use the MBAM TechNet Forum.
